officeEventDetailsSettings.freeBusyDescription: Users see events as busy/available only

calendarListScreen.noCalendarSelectedMessage: It seems that something went wrong. Please select a calendar on the left side

loginScreenModel.appLinkErrorDescription: Application link not found or it has been removed by an admin

licenseCheck.licenseDisabledBanner: Your license for Outlook Calendars for Confluence has expired.

adminConnectivityTab.connectivityHelpText: Please enter the URL under which your Confluence system is reachable from the internet. If you change the existing public URL of your system, all users will be logged out of the current instance.
adminConnectivityTab.staticIPHelpText: If you need to allow IPs in your firewall, please check out our {link1}
adminConnectivityTab.confluenceUrlHelpText: This is the publicly reachable URL of your Confluence instance

adminSharingTab.sharingDescription: This feature allows your users to share calendars with other users. Everyone will see the calendar the same way as the person that created it. Notice: if you change this setting later on, already shared calendars will still be shared!
adminSharingTab.heading: Calendar sharing settings
adminSharingTab.anonymousSharingDescription: By default shared calendars can’t be accessed by anonymous users. If you want to allow calendars to be shared on public pages you explicitly need to enable this setting.
adminSharingTab.anonymousSharingToggleLabel: Allow users to publicly share data

adminHelpTab.documentationDescription: It's always a good idea to check out our documentation first, we try to answer common questions there. Use the quick links below to get started
adminHelpTab.contactDescription: In case you need technical help or just want to learn about our product, we are happy to help!

adminOverviewTab.gettingStartedFlagDescription: Welcome to Outlook Calendars for Confluence. Go to any page and insert the calendar macro to get started!
adminOverviewTab.migrationGuideText: If you are migrating from Atlassian Team Calendars, there is an easy way to take over calendar events to your Outlook calendar. Check our migration guide for more details.

adminFeaturesOverview.pageCalendarHeading: Add Outlook calendars to Confluence pages or spaces
adminFeaturesOverview.pageCalendarText: Use Outlook calendars as a fast, powerful, and secure way to work with calendars in Confluence. Benefit from real-time data from Microsoft 365, no sync is needed. Add new project meetings directly in Confluence.
adminFeaturesOverview.addCalendarsWithTemplatesText: Add calendars by selecting from the calendar templates available in our (new) edit screen. Every single calendar template provides default settings to make it easier for you to start working with your calendars in Confluence.
adminFeaturesOverview.layoutOptionsText: Change the calendar layout depending on the calendar dates you share. Jira dates might better be displayed in a timeline view (e.g. Jira releases or sprints) while shared Outlook dates will better be shown in a calendar view (e.g. holidays or user calendar’s).
adminFeaturesOverview.scheduleMeetingsText: Schedule Outlook and Microsoft Teams meetings directly in Confluence. Even decide on whose behalf you’d like to schedule the meeting. View meeting details with a single click after sending out the invite.
adminFeaturesOverview.managePermissionsText: This goes for both Outlook calendar and Jira dates! Manage calendar permissions easily yourself. Choose who can see or edit calendars in Confluence. Decide if everyone with access to the Confluence space or page can view the data shared or if it should only be those with a Microsoft 365 or Jira Log-in.

adminGlobalMailboxesTab.heading: Shared mailboxes
adminGlobalMailboxesTab.description: Add pre-existing shared mailboxes to make them available for the "Global calendars" template. This is a legacy feature - we recommend using Outlook Group calendars or Microsoft Teams channel calendars going forward.
adminGlobalMailboxesTab.emptyStateDescription: You don't have any shared mailboxes configured yet.

generalSettingsTab.heading: General Settings
generalSettingsTab.spaceEditSettingDescription: By default, space calendar settings can only be edited by space administrators. You can allow all users with space view permissions to change the space calendar here.
generalSettingsTab.spaceEditSettingLabel: Allow non space admins to edit the space calendar

legacyCalendarFlag.officeCalendarDescription: If you want to make changes to the calendar, please remove it and add it again.
legacyCalendarFlag.jiraCalendarDescription: If you want to make changes to the calendar, please remove it and add it again.

settingsError.unknownError: An unknown error occured while saving.
